div.l: For Iohn þ̉er is A lawe that Sayethe thus
That yefe a Man in o poynte be Agreuede
That in Anoþ̉ere he schall be releuede
Ower Corne is stolne sothelye itt is no naye
And we haue hadde An euelle Fytte to daye
And syne I schall none Amendmente
Agayne my losse I woll haue esemente
By goddes sowle itt schall none other be
This Iohn Answerede Aleyn Avyse the
The Myller is A ꝑperlouse Man he sayde
And yefe he owte of his slepe Abrayede
He myghte vs doone boþe A villanye
Aleyn answerde I counte hym notte A Flye
And vppe he ryste and by þe wenche he crepeþe
This wenche laye vpprighte ⁊and Faste slepethe
Tylle he so nyghe was or sche myghte spye
That hitt hadde bene to late For to crye
And schortlye For to sayen þey were Atte oone
Now playe Aleyn For I woll speke of Iohn
This Iohn lyeþe stylle A Furlonge waye or two
And to hym selfe he makeþe Ruþe And woo
Alas qduod he this is A wyckede Iape
Now maye I sayen þat I is butte an Ape
Yette haþe my Fellawe somewhatte For his harm
He haþe the Myllers doughter in his Arme
He Auntrede hym and haþe his nedes spedde
And I lye as A draffe sacke in my bedde
And whan þis Iape is tolde Anoþ̉ere daye
I schall be holde A daffe A Cookenaye
I woll Aryse and Auntre ittitt my Faythe
Vnhardye is vnselye As Men sayethe
And vppe he rose And softelye he wente
